explanation: To determine whether metal_sys_init (or any code it invokes) violates the MISRA rule forbidding use of memcmp to compare null-terminated strings, you must inspect all functions it calls directly and transitively and any small helpers called from the body. The listed symbols are the direct callees in the static call graph (metal_init_page_sizes, metal_linux_bus_init, metal_linux_irq_init) plus their transitive callees (metal_log2, metal_add_page_size, metal_linux_probe_bus, metal_mutex_init, metal_irq_register_controller). metal_log and metal_unused are called directly from metal_sys_init and could contain memcmp usages as well. Each of these must be examined because a violation could occur in any of them (e.g., a memcmp used to compare NUL-terminated strings). Standard library/system calls used inside metal_sys_init (getenv, fopen, fread, fclose, strerror, open, srand) are not included here because their implementations are external; the rule-check focuses on the project's own symbols listed above.
